body: A Brooklyn woman with a history of neglecting her children left her 8-month-old son in a stroller outside a former police station house in Prospect Heights early Christmas morning, officials said. The woman attached a note to the child, giving both his name and that of the father, the police said. The baby boy was found at 1:30 A.M. yesterday by a
title: Mother Leaves 8-Month-Old On the Street, Then Flees

body: INTERNATIONAL A3-17 Mexican Villagers Bury Victims of Chiapas Killings The men of several small Mexican villages dug graves and began to identify the 45 people massacred in Acteal by a gang of armed men. The victims, which included 9 children and a baby, bring to at least 300 the number of people killed in the rugged southern state of Chiapas since
title: NEWS SUMMARY

body: To the Editor: Even those of us in the outer boroughs who have never lived in Manhattan have a choice as to east or west (''The Great Divide,'' Oct. 19). For me it is an easy choice: west wins hands down. Other than several trips a years to the East Side for obligatory professional visits to a museum or a gallery, I find myself on the west side of
title: Deepening the Great Divide; The East-West Divide Extends Beyond Manhattan

body: To the Editor: The regreening of Greenpoint may be under way, but now is the time for residents of northern Brooklyn to prepare to be sure it stays that way (''Trees Plant Seeds of a Fight,'' Sept. 14). An initial planting of 1,200 new trees (to replace those cut down to prevent the spread of the Asian long-horned beetle) may seem like a lot right
title: More Work Is Needed To Keep Greenpoint Green

body: Primaries are the real elections in many heavily Democratic parts of Brooklyn, and next Tuesday's ballots will feature an unusual number of competitive races for New York City Council seats. title: Brooklyn Council Endorsements

title: With Fierce Competition for Homes, Minutes to Spend Millions

body: She was the first black woman elected to the City Council, and in her 23 years in office, Mary Pinkett has come to be seen as a political fixture in central Brooklyn and in the Council itself. But Ms. Pinkett is now in the middle of a knotty re-election campaign that is calling into question her effectiveness in the Council. In a three-way race
title: Two Say It's Time the Incumbent Left

body: A SOCCER field transformed into a graveyard may be an apt symbol for the bloodshed of Sarajevo, and that image was captured on film by the United States Ambassador to Austria, Swanee Hunt. title: Ambassador's Portrait Of Death in Sarajevo

title: PLAYING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

body: To the Editor: Your article ''The Reluctant Bridesmaids'' (June 22) reminds me of Mark Twain's advice to beware activities that require new clothes. Going into debt to be a bridesmaid, or even a bride, seems quite absurd. If major portions of all that capital were put into a down payment on a home, many marriages could have a start that alleviated
title: Expenses of Bridesmaids Could Be Put to Better Use

body: To the Editor: I grew up on Staten Island, and any time I get to feeling superior when reading about Southern racial attitudes, I remind myself that I lived in a segregated neighborhood and went to segregated schools, all right here in New York City not 30 years ago. Staten Island officials, stung by a blunt statement of the truth, respond with
title: Essay on Staten Island Bias Oversimplifies the Issue

body: CUCINA ** $(rating: two stars$) (718) 230-0711; 256 Fifth Avenue (Garfield Place), Park Slope; $$; American Express, Mastercard, Visa A painted tin ceiling, sunny mural and antique wood serving tables contribute to the rustic Tuscan feel at this friendly neighborhood favorite. The engaging Italian cooking at reasonable prices completes the picture.

body: IN Detroit, Keely Robinson's parents lived in private homes, and she grew up in two of them, both in middle-class neighborhoods. Kenneth Walker has owned houses both in Toronto and the Caribbean island of Jamaica. Jason Pascal's father was a taxi driver in Trinidad and owned his own house. ''My family never paid rent,'' Mr. Pascal said. The common
title: How 'Equity Leases' Became a Track to Ownership

body: What began as a fight between teen-agers ended in gunfire on Thursday night, when the father of one of the boys shot two other youths in the Prospect Heights section of Brooklyn, leaving one of them critically injured, the police said. The police identified the gunman as David Greene, 47, of 673 Classon Avenue. He and his son Rayshaw Norman, 16,
title: Father and Son Held In Shooting in Brooklyn

body: N.B.A. Bradley Scores 19 Walt Williams scored 14 points and led a late surge as the visiting Toronto Raptors beat the new-look Dallas Mavericks, 99-92, last night. title: RESULTS PLUS

body: IT has been a century since ''cuff link'' entered the vocabulary, and as if to herald this golden anniversary, cuff links are increasingly showing up at accessories counters and in high-end catalogues. title: Cuff Links Are Making a Comeback on Stylish Wrists
